meanings.definition: The process of flowering or blooming.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with the efflorescence of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: Spring brings an efflorescence of new life to the trees and plants.
meanings.sent3: The efflorescence of daisies in the field made the bees very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting was an efflorescence of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The efflorescence of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The state or period of flowering.
meanings.sent1: The efflorescence of the cherry blossoms signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: The garden was at its peak efflorescence during the summer months.
meanings.sent3: The efflorescence of jokes during the comedy show kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The efflorescence of ideas in her mind led to a breakthrough in her research.
meanings.sent5: The efflorescence of colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: A white powdery substance that forms on the surface of bricks, concrete, or other materials due to the evaporation of water.
meanings.sent1: The old building showed signs of efflorescence on its walls.
meanings.sent2: The efflorescence on the statue made it look weathered and aged.
meanings.sent3: The efflorescence on the sidewalk looked like a sprinkle of powdered sugar.
meanings.sent4: The efflorescence on the ancient ruins added a mysterious aura to the site.
meanings.sent5: The efflorescence on the pottery gave it a unique texture.
